info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 02 at 7:38PM CST until January 04 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river in Arkansas... Black River At Pocahontas affecting Randolph County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... Black River At Black Rock affecting Jackson, Independence and Lawrence Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black River At Pocahontas. * WHEN...Until Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Flooding of backwater up tributaries is spreading into lands along the Current, Fourche, and Black rivers. Water is spreading towards the northern edge of the airport. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Sunday the stage was 16.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.0 feet just after midnight Sunday night. The river will then begin a slow fall. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.1 feet on 01/03/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecast 6 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Crest Time Date Black River Pocahontas 17.0 16.9 Sun 7 PM 14.7 12.9 12.8 17.0 12 AM 1/03 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
